org.flixel.FlxSprite

type
class
extends
FlxObject
The main "game object" class, the sprite is a FlxObject with a bunch of graphics options and abilities, like animation and stamping.

Constructor

public new(?X : Float, ?Y : Float, ?SimpleGraphic : Dynamic)
Creates a white 8x8 square FlxSprite at the specified position. Optionally can load a simple, one-frame graphic instead.
Parameters:
X - The initial X position of the sprite.
Y - The initial Y position of the sprite.
SimpleGraphic - The graphic you want to display (OPTIONAL - for simple stuff only, do NOT use for animated images!).

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

public ID : Int

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
IDs seem like they could be pretty useful, huh? They're not actually used for anything yet though.

private _alpha : Float

Internal tracker for opacity, used with Flash getter/setter.

private _animations : Array<org.flixel.system.FlxAnim>

Internal, stores all the animations that were added to this sprite.

private _bakedRotation : Float

Internal tracker for how many frames of "baked" rotation there are (if any).

private _callback : String -> UInt -> UInt -> Void

Internal tracker for the animation callback. Default is null. If assigned, will be called each time the current frame changes. A function that has 3 parameters: a string name, a uint frame number, and a uint frame index.

private _color : UInt

Internal tracker for color tint, used with Flash getter/setter.

private _colorTransform : nme.geom.ColorTransform

Internal, helps with animation, caching and drawing.

private _curAnim : org.flixel.system.FlxAnim

Internal, keeps track of the current animation being played.

private _curFrame : UInt

Internal, keeps track of the current frame of animation. This is NOT an index into the tile sheet, but the frame number in the animation object.

private _curIndex : UInt

Internal, keeps track of the current index into the tile sheet based on animation or rotation.

private _facing : Int

Internal tracker for what direction the sprite is currently facing, used with Flash getter/setter.

private _flashPoint : nme.geom.Point

Internal, reused frequently during drawing and animating.

private _flashPointZero : nme.geom.Point

Internal, reused frequently during drawing and animating. Always contains (0,0).

private _flashRect : nme.geom.Rectangle

Internal, reused frequently during drawing and animating.

private _flashRect2 : nme.geom.Rectangle

Internal, reused frequently during drawing and animating.

private _flicker : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Internal helper used for retro-style flickering.

private _flickerTimer : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Internal helper used for retro-style flickering.

private _flipped : UInt

Internal, keeps track of whether the sprite was loaded with support for automatic reverse/mirroring.

private _frameTimer : Float

Internal, used to time each frame of animation.

private _matrix : nme.geom.Matrix

Internal, helps with animation, caching and drawing.

private _pathAutoStop : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Internal flag for whether the object's should stop once it has reached the end of the path.

private _pathInc : Int

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Internal helper for node navigation, specifically yo-yo and backwards movement.

private _pathMode : Int

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Internal tracker for path behavior flags (like looping, horizontal only, etc).

private _pathNodeIndex : Int

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Internal helper, tracks which node of the path this object is moving toward.

private _pathRotate : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Internal flag for whether the object's angle should be adjusted to the path angle during path follow behavior.

private _pixels : nme.display.BitmapData

Internal, stores the entire source graphic (not the current displayed animation frame), used with Flash getter/setter.

private _point : FlxPoint

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
This is just a pre-allocated x-y point container to be used however you like

private _rect : FlxRect

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
This is just a pre-allocated rectangle container to be used however you like

private _tween : org.flixel.tweens.FlxTween

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

public acceleration : FlxPoint

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
How fast the speed of this object is changing. Useful for smooth movement and gravity.

public active : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether update() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

public alive : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Useful state for many game objects - "dead" (!alive) vs alive. kill() and revive() both flip this switch (along with exists, but you can override that).

public allowCollisions : Int

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating collision directions. Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here. Useful for things like one-way platforms (e.g. allowCollisions = UP;) The accessor "solid" just flips this variable between NONE and ANY.

public alpha(getAlpha,setAlpha) : Float

public angle : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Set the angle of a sprite to rotate it. WARNING: rotating sprites decreases rendering performance for this sprite by a factor of 10x!

public angularAcceleration : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
How fast the spin speed should change.

public angularDrag : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Like drag but for spinning.

public angularVelocity : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
This is how fast you want this sprite to spin.

public antialiasing : Bool

Controls whether the object is smoothed when rotated, affects performance.

public autoClear : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
If the Tweener should clear on removal. For Entities, this is when they are removed from a World, and for World this is when the active World is switched.

public bakedRotation(get_bakedRotation,null) : Float

If the Sprite has baked rotation.

public blend : flash.display.BlendMode

Blending modes, just like Photoshop or whatever. E.g. "multiply", "screen", etc.

public cameras : Array<FlxCamera>

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
An array of camera objects that this object will use during draw(). This value will initialize itself during the first draw to automatically point at the main camera list out in FlxG unless you already set it. You can also change it afterward too, very flexible!

public color(getColor,setColor) : UInt

public dirty : Bool

Set this flag to true to force the sprite to update during the draw() call. NOTE: Rarely if ever necessary, most sprite operations will flip this flag automatically.

public drag : FlxPoint

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
This isn't drag exactly, more like deceleration that is only applied when acceleration is not affecting the sprite.

public elasticity : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
The bounciness of this object. Only affects collisions. Default value is 0, or "not bouncy at all."

public exists : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether update() and draw() are automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

public facing(getFacing,setFacing) : Int

public finished : Bool

Whether the current animation has finished its first (or only) loop.

public flickering(getFlickering,null) : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject

public flipped(getFlipped,null) : Int

If the Sprite is flipped.

public frame(getFrame,setFrame) : UInt

public frameHeight : UInt

The height of the actual graphic or image being displayed (not necessarily the game object/bounding box). NOTE: Edit at your own risk!! This is intended to be read-only.

public framePixels : nme.display.BitmapData

The actual Flash BitmapData object representing the current display state of the sprite.

public frameWidth : UInt

The width of the actual graphic or image being displayed (not necessarily the game object/bounding box). NOTE: Edit at your own risk!! This is intended to be read-only.

public frames : UInt

The total number of frames in this image. WARNING: assumes each row in the sprite sheet is full!

public hasTween(getTween,null) : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

public health : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Handy for storing health percentage or armor points or whatever.

public height : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
The height of this object.

public ignoreDrawDebug : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Setting this to true will prevent the object from appearing when the visual debug mode in the debugger overlay is toggled on.

public immovable : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Whether an object will move/alter position after a collision.

public last : FlxPoint

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Important variable for collision processing. By default this value is set automatically during preUpdate().

public mass : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
The virtual mass of the object. Default value is 1. Currently only used with elasticity during collision resolution. Change at your own risk; effects seem crazy unpredictable so far!

public maxAngular : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Use in conjunction with angularAcceleration for fluid spin speed control.

public maxVelocity : FlxPoint

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
If you are using acceleration, you can use maxVelocity with it to cap the speed automatically (very useful!).

public moves : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Set this to false if you want to skip the automatic motion/movement stuff (see updateMotion()). FlxObject and FlxSprite default to true. FlxText, FlxTileblock, FlxTilemap and FlxSound default to false.

public offset : FlxPoint

If you changed the size of your sprite object after loading or making the graphic, you might need to offset the graphic away from the bound box to center it the way you want.

public origin : FlxPoint

WARNING: The origin of the sprite will default to its center. If you change this, the visuals and the collisions will likely be pretty out-of-sync if you do any rotation.

public path : FlxPath

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
A reference to a path object. Null by default, assigned by followPath().

public pathAngle : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
The angle in degrees between this object and the next node, where 0 is directly upward, and 90 is to the right.

public pathSpeed : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
The speed at which the object is moving on the path. When an object completes a non-looping path circuit, the pathSpeed will be zeroed out, but the path reference will NOT be nulled out. So pathSpeed is a good way to check if this object is currently following a path or not.

public pixels(getPixels,setPixels) : nme.display.BitmapData

public scale : FlxPoint

Change the size of your sprite's graphic. NOTE: Scale doesn't currently affect collisions automatically, you will need to adjust the width, height and offset manually. WARNING: scaling sprites decreases rendering performance for this sprite by a factor of 10x!

public scrollFactor : FlxPoint

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
A point that can store numbers from 0 to 1 (for X and Y independently) that governs how much this object is affected by the camera subsystem. 0 means it never moves, like a HUD element or far background graphic. 1 means it scrolls along a the same speed as the foreground layer. scrollFactor is initialized as (1,1) by default.

public simpleRender(getSimpleRender,null) : Bool

If the Sprite is beeing rendered in simple mode.

public solid(getSolid,setSolid) : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject

public touching : Int

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating surface contacts. Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here, or use touching(), justStartedTouching(), etc. You can even use them broadly as boolean values if you're feeling saucy!

public velocity : FlxPoint

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
The basic speed of this object.

public visible : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether draw() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

public wasTouching : Int

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating surface contacts from the previous game loop step. Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here, or use touching(), justStartedTouching(), etc. You can even use them broadly as boolean values if you're feeling saucy!

public width : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
The width of this object.

public x : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
X position of the upper left corner of this object in world space.

public y : Float

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Y position of the upper left corner of this object in world space.

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

public addAnimation(Name : String, Frames : Array<Int>, ?FrameRate : Int, ?Looped : Bool) : Void

Adds a new animation to the sprite.
Parameters:
Name - What this animation should be called (e.g. "run").
Frames - An array of numbers indicating what frames to play in what order (e.g. 1, 2, 3).
FrameRate - The speed in frames per second that the animation should play at (e.g. 40 fps).
Looped - Whether or not the animation is looped or just plays once.

public addAnimationCallback(AnimationCallback : String -> UInt -> UInt -> Void) : Void

Pass in a function to be called whenever this sprite's animation changes.
Parameters:
AnimationCallback - A function that has 3 parameters: a string name, a uint frame number, and a uint frame index.

public addTween(t : org.flixel.tweens.FlxTween, ?start : Bool) : org.flixel.tweens.FlxTween

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

private advancePath(?Snap : Bool) : FlxPoint

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Internal function that decides what node in the path to aim for next based on the behavior flags.
Returns:
The node (a FlxPoint object) we are aiming for next.

private calcFrame() : Void

Internal function to update the current animation frame.

public centerOffsets(?AdjustPosition : Bool) : Void

Helper function that adjusts the offset automatically to center the bounding box within the graphic.
Parameters:
AdjustPosition - Adjusts the actual X and Y position just once to match the offset change. Default is false.

public clearTweens() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

public destroy() : Void

overrides org.flixel.FlxObject
Clean up memory.

public draw() : Void

overrides org.flixel.FlxObject
Called by game loop, updates then blits or renders current frame of animation to the screen

public drawDebug(?Camera : FlxCamera) : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Override this function to draw custom "debug mode" graphics to the specified camera while the debugger's visual mode is toggled on.
Parameters:
Camera - Which camera to draw the debug visuals to.

public drawFrame(?Force : Bool) : Void

Request (or force) that the sprite update the frame before rendering. Useful if you are doing procedural generation or other weirdness!
Parameters:
Force - Force the frame to redraw, even if its not flagged as necessary.

public drawLine(StartX : Float, StartY : Float, EndX : Float, EndY : Float, Color : UInt, ?Thickness : UInt) : Void

This function draws a line on this sprite from position X1,Y1 to position X2,Y2 with the specified color.
Parameters:
StartX - X coordinate of the line's start point.
StartY - Y coordinate of the line's start point.
EndX - X coordinate of the line's end point.
EndY - Y coordinate of the line's end point.
Color - The line's color.
Thickness - How thick the line is in pixels (default value is 1).

public fill(Color : UInt) : Void

Fills this sprite's graphic with a specific color.
Parameters:
Color - The color with which to fill the graphic, format 0xAARRGGBB.

public flicker(?Duration : Float) : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Tells this object to flicker, retro-style. Pass a negative value to flicker forever.
Parameters:
Duration - How many seconds to flicker for.

public followPath(Path : FlxPath, ?Speed : Float, ?Mode : Int, ?AutoRotate : Bool, ?StopWhenFinished : Bool) : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Call this function to give this object a path to follow. If the path does not have at least one node in it, this function will log a warning message and return.
Parameters:
Path - The FlxPath you want this object to follow.
Speed - How fast to travel along the path in pixels per second.
Mode - Optional, controls the behavior of the object following the path using the path behavior constants. Can use multiple flags at once, for example PATH_YOYO|PATH_HORIZONTAL_ONLY will make an object move back and forth along the X axis of the path only.
AutoRotate - Automatically point the object toward the next node. Assumes the graphic is pointing upward. Default behavior is false, or no automatic rotation.
StopWhenFinished - Automatically stop the player from moving once they have reached the final node in the path. Default is "false" just so it won't conflict with code written for previous versions.

public getAlpha() : Float

Set alpha to a number between 0 and 1 to change the opacity of the sprite.

public getColor() : UInt

Set color to a number in this format: 0xRRGGBB. color IGNORES ALPHA. To change the opacity use alpha. Tints the whole sprite to be this color (similar to OpenGL vertex colors).

public getFacing() : Int

Set facing using FlxSprite.LEFT,RIGHT, UP, and DOWN to take advantage of flipped sprites and/or just track player orientation more easily.

public getFlickering() : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Check to see if the object is still flickering.
Returns:
Whether the object is flickering or not.

public getFlipped() : Int

public getFrame() : UInt

Tell the sprite to change to a specific frame of animation.
Parameters:
Frame - The frame you want to display.

public getMidpoint(?point : FlxPoint) : FlxPoint

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Retrieve the midpoint of this object in world coordinates.
Returns:
A FlxPoint object containing the midpoint of this object in world coordinates.

public getPixels() : nme.display.BitmapData

Set pixels to any BitmapData object. Automatically adjust graphic size and render helpers.

public getScreenXY(?point : FlxPoint, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : FlxPoint

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Call this function to figure out the on-screen position of the object.
Parameters:
Camera - Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
Point - Takes a FlxPoint object and assigns the post-scrolled X and Y values of this object to it.
Returns:
The Point you passed in, or a new Point if you didn't pass one, containing the screen X and Y position of this object.

public getSimpleRender() : Bool

public getSolid() : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Whether the object collides or not. For more control over what directions the object will collide from, use collision constants (like LEFT, FLOOR, etc) to set the value of allowCollisions directly.

private getTween() : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

private get_bakedRotation() : Float

public hurt(Damage : Float) : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Reduces the "health" variable of this sprite by the amount specified in Damage. Calls kill() if health drops to or below zero.
Parameters:
Damage - How much health to take away (use a negative number to give a health bonus).

public isTouching(Direction : Int) : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Handy function for checking if this object is touching a particular surface. For slightly better performance you can just & the value directly into touching. However, this method is good for readability and accessibility.
Parameters:
Direction - Any of the collision flags (e.g. LEFT, FLOOR, etc).
Returns:
Whether the object is touching an object in (any of) the specified direction(s) this frame.

public justTouched(Direction : Int) : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Handy function for checking if this object is just landed on a particular surface.
Parameters:
Direction - Any of the collision flags (e.g. LEFT, FLOOR, etc).
Returns:
Whether the object just landed on (any of) the specified surface(s) this frame.

public kill() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for "killing" game objects. Default behavior is to flag them as nonexistent AND dead. However, if you want the "corpse" to remain in the game, like to animate an effect or whatever, you should override this, setting only alive to false, and leaving exists true.

public loadFrom(Sprite : FlxSprite, ?AutoBuffer : Bool) : FlxSprite

Load graphic from another FlxSprite and copy it's tileSheet data. This method usefull for non-flash targets
Parameters:
Sprite - The FlxSprite from which you want to load graphic data
AutoBuffer - Use this parameter when loading graphic from FlxSprite with "rotated" graphic (graphic loaded with loadRotatedGraphic() method). It should have the same value as you passed to loadRotatedGraphic() method for original FlxSprite.
Returns:
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).

public loadGraphic(Graphic : Dynamic, ?Animated : Bool, ?Reverse : Bool, ?Width : Int, ?Height : Int, ?Unique : Bool) : FlxSprite

Load an image from an embedded graphic file.
Parameters:
Graphic - The image you want to use.
Animated - Whether the Graphic parameter is a single sprite or a row of sprites.
Reverse - Whether you need this class to generate horizontally flipped versions of the animation frames.
Width - Optional, specify the width of your sprite (helps FlxSprite figure out what to do with non-square sprites or sprite sheets).
Height - Optional, specify the height of your sprite (helps FlxSprite figure out what to do with non-square sprites or sprite sheets).
Unique - Optional, whether the graphic should be a unique instance in the graphics cache. Default is false.
Returns:
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).

public loadRotatedGraphic(Graphic : Dynamic, ?Rotations : Int, ?Frame : Int, ?AntiAliasing : Bool, ?AutoBuffer : Bool) : FlxSprite

Create a pre-rotated sprite sheet from a simple sprite. This can make a huge difference in graphical performance!
Parameters:
Graphic - The image you want to rotate and stamp.
Rotations - The number of rotation frames the final sprite should have. For small sprites this can be quite a large number (360 even) without any problems.
Frame - If the Graphic has a single row of square animation frames on it, you can specify which of the frames you want to use here. Default is -1, or "use whole graphic."
AntiAliasing - Whether to use high quality rotations when creating the graphic. Default is false.
AutoBuffer - Whether to automatically increase the image size to accomodate rotated corners. Default is false. Will create frames that are 150% larger on each axis than the original frame or graphic.
Returns:
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).

public makeGraphic(Width : UInt, Height : UInt, ?Color : UInt, ?Unique : Bool, ?Key : String) : FlxSprite

This function creates a flat colored square image dynamically.
Parameters:
Width - The width of the sprite you want to generate.
Height - The height of the sprite you want to generate.
Color - Specifies the color of the generated block.
Unique - Whether the graphic should be a unique instance in the graphics cache. Default is false.
Key - Optional parameter - specify a string key to identify this graphic in the cache. Trumps Unique flag.
Returns:
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).

public onScreen(?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

overrides org.flixel.FlxObject
Check and see if this object is currently on screen. Differs from FlxObject's implementation in that it takes the actual graphic into account, not just the hitbox or bounding box or whatever.
Parameters:
Camera - Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
Returns:
Whether the object is on screen or not.

public overlaps(ObjectOrGroup : FlxBasic, ?InScreenSpace : Bool, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Checks to see if some FlxObject overlaps this FlxObject or FlxGroup. If the group has a LOT of things in it, it might be faster to use FlxG.overlaps(). WARNING: Currently tilemaps do NOT support screen space overlap checks!
Parameters:
ObjectOrGroup - The object or group being tested.
InScreenSpace - Whether to take scroll factors into account when checking for overlap. Default is false, or "only compare in world space."
Camera - Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
Returns:
Whether or not the two objects overlap.

public overlapsAt(X : Float, Y : Float, ObjectOrGroup : FlxBasic, ?InScreenSpace : Bool, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Checks to see if this FlxObject were located at the given position, would it overlap the FlxObject or FlxGroup? This is distinct from overlapsPoint(), which just checks that point, rather than taking the object's size into account. WARNING: Currently tilemaps do NOT support screen space overlap checks!
Parameters:
X - The X position you want to check. Pretends this object (the caller, not the parameter) is located here.
Y - The Y position you want to check. Pretends this object (the caller, not the parameter) is located here.
ObjectOrGroup - The object or group being tested.
InScreenSpace - Whether to take scroll factors into account when checking for overlap. Default is false, or "only compare in world space."
Camera - Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
Returns:
Whether or not the two objects overlap.

public overlapsPoint(point : FlxPoint, ?InScreenSpace : Bool, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Checks to see if a point in 2D world space overlaps this FlxObject object.
Parameters:
Point - The point in world space you want to check.
InScreenSpace - Whether to take scroll factors into account when checking for overlap.
Camera - Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
Returns:
Whether or not the point overlaps this object.

public pixelsOverlapPoint(point : FlxPoint, ?Mask : UInt, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

Checks to see if a point in 2D world space overlaps this FlxSprite object's current displayed pixels. This check is ALWAYS made in screen space, and always takes scroll factors into account.
Parameters:
Point - The point in world space you want to check.
Mask - Used in the pixel hit test to determine what counts as solid.
Camera - Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
Returns:
Whether or not the point overlaps this object.

public play(AnimName : String, ?Force : Bool) : Void

Plays an existing animation (e.g. "run"). If you call an animation that is already playing it will be ignored.
Parameters:
AnimName - The string name of the animation you want to play.
Force - Whether to force the animation to restart.

public postUpdate() : Void

overrides org.flixel.FlxObject
Automatically called after update() by the game loop, this function just calls updateAnimation().

public preUpdate() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Pre-update is called right before update() on each object in the game loop. In FlxObject it controls the flicker timer, tracking the last coordinates for collision purposes, and checking if the object is moving along a path or not.

public randomFrame() : Void

Tell the sprite to change to a random frame of animation Useful for instantiating particles or other weird things.

public removeTween(t : org.flixel.tweens.FlxTween) : org.flixel.tweens.FlxTween

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

public replaceColor(Color : UInt, NewColor : UInt, ?FetchPositions : Bool) : Array<FlxPoint>

public reset(X : Float, Y : Float) : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Handy function for reviving game objects. Resets their existence flags and position.
Parameters:
X - The new X position of this object.
Y - The new Y position of this object.

private resetHelpers() : Void

Resets some important variables for sprite optimization and rendering.

public revive() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for bringing game objects "back to life". Just sets alive and exists back to true. In practice, this function is most often called by FlxObject.reset().

public setAlpha(Alpha : Float) : Float

public setOriginToCorner() : Void

Helper function that just sets origin to (0,0)

public setSolid(Solid : Bool) : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject

public stamp(Brush : FlxSprite, ?X : Int, ?Y : Int) : Void

This function draws or stamps one FlxSprite onto another. This function is NOT intended to replace draw()!
Parameters:
Brush - The image you want to use as a brush or stamp or pen or whatever.
X - The X coordinate of the brush's top left corner on this sprite.
Y - They Y coordinate of the brush's top left corner on this sprite.

public stopFollowingPath(?DestroyPath : Bool, ?StopMoving : Bool) : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Tells this object to stop following the path its on.
Parameters:
DestroyPath - Tells this function whether to call destroy on the path object. Default value is false.

public toString() : String

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Convert object to readable string name. Useful for debugging, save games, etc.

public update() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Override this function to update your class's position and appearance. This is where most of your game rules and behavioral code will go.

private updateAnimation() : Void

Internal function for updating the sprite's animation. Useful for cases when you need to update this but are buried down in too many supers. This function is called automatically by FlxSprite.postUpdate().

private updateMotion() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Internal function for updating the position and speed of this object. Useful for cases when you need to update this but are buried down in too many supers. Does a slightly fancier-than-normal integration to help with higher fidelity framerate-independenct motion.

private updatePathMotion() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxObject
Internal function for moving the object along the path. Generally this function is called automatically by preUpdate(). The first half of the function decides if the object can advance to the next node in the path, while the second half handles actually picking a velocity toward the next node.

public updateTileSheet() : Void

Use this method for creating tileSheet for FlxSprite. Must be called after makeGraphic(), loadGraphic or loadRotatedGraphic(). If you forget to call it then you will not see this FlxSprite on c++ target

public updateTweens() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
